repnme.cdata!:
Easing Armenia's transition to a
            market economy

abstracts.cdata!:
With independence in 1991, Armenia
            suffered a severe economic contraction. Between 1990 and
            1993, GDP dropped by more than 50 percent. This led to
            hyperinflation, a budget deficit that reached a high of 55
            percent, factory closures, little electricity supply, and
            large-scale emigration. About 80 percent of the population
            survived on humanitarian assistance and more than half the
            population lived below the poverty line.

docna.cdata!: Transicion de Armenia hacia una economia de mercado

display_title.display_title:
Easing Armenia's transition
            to a market economy : Transicion de Armenia hacia una
            economia de mercado

repnme.cdata!:
Armenia - Third Structural Adjustment
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and the institutional development
            impact substantial. Valuable lessons are drawn from the
            project, mainly that the success of this project, reinforces
            the important role technical assistance (TA) lending plays
            in advancing adjustment operations, for such instrument
            provides the required flexibility to adjust legislative, and
            procedural changes to achieve reforms, as in this case,
            restructuring and privatization. Moreover, it also played a
            crucial role in introducing implementing agencies to the
            state-owned companies, while the close coordination of the
            TA - funded by bilateral, and multilateral donors - provided
            high quality advice. Nonetheless, it is important to note
            that realistic estimates of privatization obstacles, and
            timing requirements in adjustment operations can be
            critical: both the Bank, and the Government initially
            underestimated the barriers to the strategic privatization
            of electricity companies - given imposed policy conditions
            that could not be met as scheduled. Invariably,
            privatization in sectors with deep vested interests, may
            turn deceitful, presenting unforeseen obstacles, and delays;
            thus, conditionality may become useful to build political
            consensus, provided flexibility is exercised in granting
            waivers for justifiable reasons. Finally, the counterpart
            capacity of the Government economic team provided the
            crucial support to achieve a successful comprehensive
            adjustment operation.

docna.cdata!: Armenia - Third Structural Adjustment Credit Project

display_title.display_title:
Armenia - Third Structural
            Adjustment Credit Project

repnme.cdata!:
Armenia - Third Structural Adjustment
            Credit (SAC III)

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Third Structural
            Adjustment Credit are to support the Government's
            program towards consolidation of the macroeconomic stability
            and develop a sustainable private sector growth over the
            medium term. The program includes the improvement of
            financial disciplines, both in the private and public
            sectors, geared to an increased domestic savings, to foster
            external adjustment, and creditworthiness. Furthermore, the
            program aims at accelerating the private sector development
            and ensuring the social sustainability of the reform
            process, for the preservation of the country's human
            capital. Armenia will benefit from the credit's
            financial support in covering costs associated with its
            economic reforms. It is also envisaged, that support
            measures for the improvement of social benefits and the
            strengthening of social safety nets will be provided by the
            credit. Even though the risk in policy reversals is small,
            there is a possible deterioration in the macroeconomic and
            political environment.
